doc:
Rich Hall https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rich_Hall 0 Richard Travis Hall (born 10 June 1954) is an American comedian, writer, and musician, first coming to prominence as a sketch comedian in the 1980s. He wrote and performed for a range of American networks, in series such as Fridays, Not Necessarily the News (popularising the "sniglet" neologism), and Saturday Night Live. After winning a Perrier Comedy Award in 2000, using the character of Tennesseean country musician Otis Lee Crenshaw, Hall became popular in the United Kingdom, regularly appearing on QI and similar panel shows. He has created and starred in several series for the BBC, including comedies with Mike Wilmot, and documentaries often concerning cinema of the United States. Hall has also maintained a successful stand-up comedy career, as both Crenshaw and himself. Richard_Travis_Hall ( born_10_June_1954 ) is an_American_comedian , writer , and musician , first coming to prominence as a_sketch_comedian in the_1980s . He wrote and performed for a_range of American_networks , in series such_as Fridays , Not_Necessarily the_News (_popularising the_"_sniglet_"_neologism_) , and Saturday_Night_Live . After winning a_Perrier_Comedy_Award in 2000 , using the_character of Tennesseean_country_musician_Otis_Lee_Crenshaw , Hall became popular in the_United_Kingdom , regularly appearing on QI and similar_panel_shows . He has_created_and_starred in several_series for the_BBC , including_comedies with Mike_Wilmot , and documentaries often_concerning cinema of the_United_States . Hall has_also_maintained a_successful_stand-up_comedy_career , as both_Crenshaw and himself .
